result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Wiskowski

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 9:14 am
INCLUDES 22CF82, 22CF970, 22CF1036, 22TR165.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person.
Defendant appears in custody, in person, and with Atty Heather Roehr in person;
VRCW. 
COURT QUASHES WARRANT(S).

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
22CF82:
Ct. 2 (Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)>> DRI.

22CF1036:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>> DRI.
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> DRI.

22CF970:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>> DRI.

22TR165:
Ct. 1 (Refuse to Take Test for Intoxication After Arrest)>> DISMISS OUTRIGHT.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
22CF82:
Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>> GUILTY.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
22CF82:
Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>> Sentence W/H- 3 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: $600 Fine plus Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. 6 Months MCJ with EMP - Court finds 30 Days Court Credit to be applied to the conditional jail time. Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 Years, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; 1/2 price IID installation fee to be paid; 3 Year dl revocation with any administrative credit; AODA, Absolute Sobriety and No Possession of Alcohol, No Driving without a Valid License, Good Faith Effort to comply with Driver's Safety Plan. Defendant has 10 Days to Report to MCJ to serve sentence. 

Adjourned: 9:29 am

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:42 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant does NOT appear. 
COURT makes findings - finds factual basis. 
COURT authorizes $800 bench warrant. 
Adj: 2:43 pm
